sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Cramer's rule
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using Cramer's rule: 

2x + 3y - z = 1 

x - 2y + 3z = -7 

3x + 2y + 4z = 4
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using Cramer's rule, we first need to find the determinant of the coefficient matrix (D), and then the determinants of the matrices obtained by replacing each column with the constant terms (Dx, Dy, Dz). Finally, we will find the values of x, y, and z by dividing the respective determinants by D.

The coefficient matrix is:
| 2  3 -1 |
| 1 -2  3 |
| 3  2  4 |

To find the determinant D:
D = 2((-2)(4) - (3)(2)) - 3((1)(4) - (3)(3)) - (-1)((1)(2) - (-2)(3))
D = 2(-8 - 6) - 3(4 - 9) + (2 + 6)
D = 2(-14) + 3(5) + 8
D = -28 + 15 + 8
D = -5

Now, we will find Dx, Dy, and Dz.

For Dx, replace the first column with the constant terms:
| 1 -7  4 |
| 3 -2  2 |
| 4  3  4 |

Dx = 1((-2)(4) - (2)(3)) - (-7)((3)(4) - (2)(3)) + 4((3)(3) - (-2)(4))
Dx = 1(-8 - 6) + 7(12 - 6) + 4(9 + 8)
Dx = -14 + 42 + 68
Dx = 96

For Dy, replace the second column with the constant terms:
| 2  1 -1 |
| 1 -7  3 |
| 3  4  4 |

Dy = 2((-7)(4) - (3)(4)) - 1((1)(4) - (3)(3)) + (-1)((1)(4) - (-7)(3))
Dy = 2(-28 - 12) - (4 - 9) - (4 + 21)
Dy = -80 + 5 - 25
Dy = -100

For Dz, replace the third column with the constant terms:
| 2  3  1 |
| 1 -2 -7 |
| 3  2  4 |

Dz = 2((-2)(4) - (-7)(2)) - 3((1)(4) - (-7)(3)) + 1((1)(2) - (-2)(3))
Dz = 2(-8 + 14) - 3(4 + 21) + (2 + 6)
Dz = 12 - 75 + 8
Dz = -55

Now, we can find the values of x, y, and z:

x = Dx / D = 96 / (-5) = -19.2
y = Dy / D = -100 / (-5) = 20
z = Dz / D = -55 / (-5) = 11

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is x = -19.2, y = 20, and z = 11.
